metadata.title: CVE-2020-36766 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.8.6.drivers/media/cec/core/cec-api.c leaks one byte of kernel memory onspecific hardware to unprivileged users, because of directly assigninglog_addrs with a hole in the struct.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-78-generic - 5.15.0-78.85
linux-image-5.15.0-78-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-78.85
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-78-generic - 5.15.0-78.85
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-78-generic-64k - 5.15.0-78.85
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-78.85').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
